citations.narrative:
According to facility representatives, On July 27, 2024 at 10am a mink gained entry into the outdoor guinea pig enclosure
and attacked 4 guinea pigs. Two guinea pigs were killed and two were injured immediately. There were members of the
public in the area that immediately reported seeing what they thought was a 'mongoose' in the guinea pig area, however
when the zoo staff quickly arrived they determined it was a mink. The staff was able to get all of the other guinea pigs to
safety, and got treatment for the two remaining guinea pigs. While the enclosure and fencing was in good condition and
was able to secure the guinea pigs inside and prevent people from gaining entrance, the enclosure fence was unable to
prevent a mink from gaining access and making contact with the guinea pigs, resulting in injuries of two and the death of
two animals.
The lack of a structually sound enclosure for guinea pigs could allow for predatory animals to enter the enclosure causing
stress, injury or death to the regulated animals contained within.
Indoor and outdoor housing facilities for guinea pigs or hamsters shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in
good repair, to protect the animals from injury, to contain the animals, and to restrict the entrance of other animals.
To correct by: Corrected prior to inspection on July 27, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.25(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
According to facility representatives, On July 27, 2024 at 10am a mink gained entry into the outdoor guinea pig enclosure 
and attacked 4 guinea pigs. Two guinea pigs were killed and two were injured immediately. There were members of the 
public in the area that immediately reported seeing what they thought was a 'mongoose' in the guinea pig area, however 
when the zoo staff quickly arrived they determined it was a mink. The staff was able to get all of the other guinea pigs to 
safety, and got treatment for the two remaining guinea pigs. While the enclosure and fencing was in good condition and 
was able to secure the guinea pigs inside and prevent people from gaining entrance, the enclosure fence was unable to 
prevent a mink from gaining access and making contact with the guinea pigs, resulting in injuries of two and the death of 
two animals. 
 
The lack of a structually sound enclosure for guinea pigs could allow for predatory animals to enter the enclosure causing 
stress, injury or death to the regulated animals contained within. 
 
 Indoor and outdoor housing facilities for guinea pigs or hamsters shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in 
good repair, to protect the animals from injury, to contain the animals, and to restrict the entrance of other animals. 
 
To correct by: Corrected prior to inspection on July 27, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
